timeline.message: Rename db.type to db.system, db.instance to db.name, db.url to db.connection_string
Add jdbc README and fix a typo
Use SemanticAttribute instead of hardcoded strings

timeline.body: i think rename to `DbSystem`, that way usages will be more descriptive, e.g. `DbSystem.MYSQL`
timeline.bodyText: i think rename to DbSystem, that way usages will be more descriptive, e.g. DbSystem.MYSQL
timeline.bodyHTML: i think rename to DbSystem, that way usages will be more descriptive, e.g. DbSystem.MYSQL

timeline.body:
i think we really do want `type` here (and not system) in order to construct the "short url" (which we then use as `db.connection_string`).

it looks like this method is only called from one place, so you could pass in the real `type` here, so you don't have to add another field to DbInfo/Builder
timeline.bodyText:
i think we really do want type here (and not system) in order to construct the "short url" (which we then use as db.connection_string).
it looks like this method is only called from one place, so you could pass in the real type here, so you don't have to add another field to DbInfo/Builder
timeline.bodyHTML:
i think we really do want type here (and not system) in order to construct the "short url" (which we then use as db.connection_string).

it looks like this method is only called from one place, so you could pass in the real type here, so you don't have to add another field to DbInfo/Builder
timeline.author: trask

timeline.body:
this happens to match the constant, but is not really related to db_system (this is why I recommended to rename `Constants` to `DbSystem` above to make this more clear where to use it)
```suggestion
    super("jedis", "redis");
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
this happens to match the constant, but is not really related to db_system (this is why I recommended to rename Constants to DbSystem above to make this more clear where to use it)

Suggested change
super("jedis", Constants.REDIS);
super("jedis", "redis");
timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyHTML:
something like (see comment below), also probably still want typeParsers key to be type and not system

Suggested change
String baseSystem = jdbcUrl.substring(0, typeLoc);
baseSystem = updateDbSystem(baseSystem);
String type = jdbcUrl.substring(0, typeLoc);
String system = updateDbSystem(type);
timeline.author: trask

timeline.message:
Link the latest copy of database.md

Co-authored-by: Trask Stalnaker <trask.stalnaker@gmail.com>
Only show differences in JDBC README.md

Keep type to parsers

Keep subtype for mssqlparser and update its tests

Address other code review comments

timeline.body:
i think better not to compare driver type to db.system constant, e.g. if the spec could change the db.system constant, but that wouldn't change the driver type
```suggestion
      if (type.equals("db2") || type.equals("as400")) {
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
i think better not to compare driver type to db.system constant, e.g. if the spec could change the db.system constant, but that wouldn't change the driver type

Suggested change
if (type.equals(DbSystem.DB2) || type.equals(DbSystem.AS400)) {
if (type.equals("db2") || type.equals("as400")) {
timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyHTML:
i think this matches other parsing a bit better:

Suggested change
int typeLoc = jdbcUrl.indexOf(":"); // type
int subtypeLoc = jdbcUrl.indexOf(":", typeLoc + 1); // subtype
int hostLoc = jdbcUrl.indexOf("//");
if (subtypeLoc != -1 && typeLoc != -1 && typeLoc < subtypeLoc && subtypeLoc < hostLoc) {
String subtype = jdbcUrl.substring(typeLoc + 1, subtypeLoc);
int protoLoc = jdbcUrl.indexOf("://");
int typeEndLoc = jdbcUrl.indexOf(':');
if (protoLoc > typeEndLoc) {
String subtype = jdbcUrl.substring(typeEndLoc + 1, protoLoc);
timeline.author: trask

timeline.message:
Separate driver type from db.system.

Co-authored-by: Trask Stalnaker <trask.stalnaker@gmail.com>

Use a consistent parsing for subtype.

Co-authored-by: Trask Stalnaker <trask.stalnaker@gmail.com>

Keep db.system for jdcb drivers only

Map as400 to db2
Don't use DbSystem constants for jdbc driver types
